intro: Pimpinella tenera, commonly known as the slender cow-wheat, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa, this plant thrives in dry, rocky habitats. It is often found in open woodlands and along coastal areas. The plant's aromatic foliage and unique appearance make it a notable species in its native ecosystems.
